Q4 FY25 Results (as announced on May 16, 2025):Medanta reported a 20% year-on-year slide in net profit for Q4 FY25, impacted by non-recurring exceptional expenses related to the merger of MHPL with GHL.

FY25 Annual Earnings:Revenue from operations increased by 12.7% to ₹3,692 crore, while net profit saw a marginal uptick of 0.7% to ₹481 crore.

Q1 FY25 Results (as announced on May 26, 2025):Consolidated profit after tax increased by 4% year on year to ₹106 crore, and revenue from operations rose to ₹861 crore.

Expansion Plans:

Medanta plans to invest ₹4,000 crore to reach a capacity of 6,000 beds over the next 3-4 years.

This expansion includes adding 1,000 beds in the next 2 years, with major projects in Noida, Mumbai, Pitampura, Ranchi, and Guwahati.

The Noida project is expected to be operational by September 2025.

The company has received confirmation of a successful bid for a land parcel in Mumbai for a 500+ bed super-specialty hospital, marking its entry into the Mumbai market.

Medanta added 219 new beds across its network in FY25.

Average occupancy rate for FY25 was 62%.

Developing hospitals demonstrated strong growth, with revenue surging by 35.9% in Q1 FY26.

Average revenue per occupied bed (ARPOB) saw marginal year-on-year increases in Q4 FY25, and management expects future growth to be in the low- to mid-single-digit range.

Medanta Gurugram was recognized in Newsweek's 'World's Best Hospitals' list for the sixth consecutive year, according to Asian News International in April 2025.
